column4: shrunk my 250gb disk from 250 to 80gb and it took about 1 1/2 hours. so I
I'm on a livecd now.
ahh thanks.
does this mean that there is a bad block, but it's fixing or just pressing with the test? "23652896done, 1:15:50 elapsed"
looks like it's still scanning the disk. wow how big is your HD?

Also, it just said  96.11% done, 1:16:25 elapsed Interrupt caught, cleaning up and then brought the prompt back.  I scanned a few different sections at a time, this section was 25gig... it takes about an hourish
ok cool and you ran it with fsck -a right?
I haven't done that one yet
oh ok.
your still on your live cd right?
Yep
ok... try running the fsck -a /dev/"whatever your disk partition is"
I get this "fsck: fsck.swap: not found ; fsck: Error 2 while executing fsck.swap for /dev/sda5"  when running fsck -a /dev/sda5
Is it because I had the swapoff when i was deleted the extra linux swap space?
hmm, good question.
Turned it back on, and trying again.
have you tried to remove the swap first, then add in to swap?
no, i just tried it with swapon and it still failed for the same reason.
I will brb as well, I'm going to double check that I haven't screwed anything up recently and boot into my actual system.
great idea
The fsck finished, i have 113 bad sectors, what do i do now?
fix them =), fsck -a should auto-repair the bad blocks
or run fsck -a with the -y options as well as -a
